AboutPage.sections.title: From Mountain Child to TCM Explorer: The Origin of Sheng Haiwang and HeyTCM

body.title: Body's Alarms and Unsolved Mysteries
body.para: I was born in a remote mountain village and was frail and sickly as a child. Bedwetting haunted my childhood until I was 10—waking up to cold, damp sheets. I didn’t understand what my body was telling me, only enduring the teasing of peers and my own shame.
In college, digestive issues and hand tremors followed. I kept asking myself: ‘What’s wrong with me? Why does my body seem fine but feel so uncomfortable in ways I can’t explain?’

body.title: A Medical Engineer’s Quest
body.para: My career path seemed destined. I became a software engineer in the health sector, developing countless health systems and products over 15 years. Ironically, while I could help build solutions for others, I couldn’t decipher my own body’s signals.

At 35, urticaria and insomnia seriously affected my life. Western medicine found nothing wrong, and treatments had little effect. By chance, I encountered TCM theories and delved into concepts like Qi and Blood, and the interplay of organs. TCM’s holistic and balanced approach offered a new framework to understand my long-standing issues.

body.title: A Mission: Illuminating TCM with Technology
body.para: As I deepened my understanding of TCM, a vision emerged: this ancient wisdom is being marginalized in modern society not due to ineffectiveness, but because it lacks an accessible, modern expression.

Could the experience-based diagnostics of TCM be made more objective with technology and data? Could ancient theories like Qi, Blood, Yin, and Yang be quantified and visualized with modern sensors, revealing TCM’s scientific value to more people?
With these questions, I founded HeyTCM—to bridge ancient TCM wisdom and modern innovation, offering new perspectives and solutions for today’s health challenges.

body.title: Vision 1: Digital TCM
body.para: Driving the digital and intelligent transformation of TCM to benefit more people with its science and warmth.

items.title: Smart Health Management
items.para: Enhancing health management with data and algorithms.

items.title: Open Ecosystem

items.title: Heritage and Innovation
items.para: Blending traditional wisdom with modern technology to innovate TCM expression.
